title: How to Construct a Regular Pentagon

steps.title: Draw a line segment AB.
steps.content: Draw a line segment AB. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Draw two circles, 1 and 2, centred at A and B, both with radius AB.
steps.content: Draw two circles, 1 and 2, centred at A and B, both with radius AB. The points where they intersect each other are C and D. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Draw circle 3 with centre C and radius AB.
steps.content: Draw circle 3 with centre C and radius AB. Circle 3 intersects circles 1 and 2 in E and F respectively. It also intersects line segment DC in G. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Connect E and F with G.
steps.content: Connect E and F with G. Extend these lines far enough so they intersect circles 1 and 2. Call these new intersection points H and I.

steps.title: Draw circles 4 and 5 centred at H and I with radius AB.
steps.content: Draw circles 4 and 5 centred at H and I with radius AB. Name the upper intersection point J. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Connect A, B, I, J and H.
steps.content: Connect A, B, I, J and H. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Trace the pentagon in ink or another colour and erase any construction lines (if needed).
steps.content: Trace the pentagon in ink or another colour and erase any construction lines (if needed).
